pageContext.claim: “Look, Michigan has car factories now. They didn't open a factory in 40 years and we have factories now being built. … They've never had anything like this. They are doing great only because of what I did.”
pageContext.analysis: Only five new auto plants (two by U.S. manufacturers) have been announced since Trump took office, according to experts at the Center for Automotive Research, a group that assiduously tracks this information. They count three in Michigan, one in Alabama and one in Texas. Investment in auto manufacturing was higher under the last three years of Barack Obama’s presidency than the first three of Trump’s.  There’s no evidence that Trump’s threat of tariffs led to more auto investment.
